nodes.label: Basic Rendering
nodes.title: Basic Rendering
nodes.description: Basic Rendering: encompasses the fundamental concepts and techniques used to create visual representations of 3D scenes in computer graphics

nodes.label: Graphics pipeline.
nodes.title: Graphics pipeline.
nodes.description: Graphics pipeline.: is the sequence of stages through which 3D geometry is transformed, shaded, and rasterized to produce the final image on the screen

nodes.label: Rendering in nature
nodes.title: Rendering in nature
nodes.description: Rendering in nature: e.g. the emission and scattering of light and its relation tnumerical integration.

nodes.label: Forward and backward rendering
nodes.title: Forward and backward rendering
nodes.description: Forward and backward rendering: i.e., ray-casting and rasterization

nodes.label: Polygonal representation.
nodes.title: Polygonal representation.
nodes.description: Polygonal representation.: Polygonal meshes composed of vertices, edges, and faces are commonly used to represent 3D objects in computer graphics due to their simplicity and efficiency.

nodes.label: Basic radiometry, similar triangles, and projection model.
nodes.title: Basic radiometry, similar triangles, and projection model.
nodes.description: Basic radiometry, similar triangles, and projection model.:

nodes.label: Affine and coordinate system transformations.
nodes.title: Affine and coordinate system transformations.
nodes.description: Affine and coordinate system transformations.:

nodes.label: Ray tracing.
nodes.title: Ray tracing.
nodes.description: Ray tracing.: Ray tracing is a rendering technique that simulates the path of light rays

nodes.label: Visibility and occlusion
nodes.title: Visibility and occlusion
nodes.description: Visibility and occlusion: including solutions tthis problem such as depth buffering, Painter's algorithm. and ray tracing.

nodes.label: The rendering equation.
nodes.title: The rendering equation.
nodes.description: The rendering equation.: The rendering equation is a fundamental equation in computer graphics that describes the total incoming light at a point in a scene as the sum of emitted, reflected, and transmitted light, accounting for surface properties and lighting conditions.

nodes.label: Simple triangle rasterization.
nodes.title: Simple triangle rasterization.
nodes.description: Simple triangle rasterization.: Triangle rasterization algorithms determine which pixels are covered by a triangle and interpolate vertex attributes across the triangle's surface.

nodes.label: Rendering with a shader-based API.
nodes.title: Rendering with a shader-based API.
nodes.description: Rendering with a shader-based API.: Modern rendering pipelines often use shader-based APIs, such as OpenGL and DirectX, to programmatically define the shading, lighting, and other rendering effects applied to objects in a scene.

nodes.label: Texture mapping
nodes.title: Texture mapping
nodes.description: Texture mapping: including minification and magnification (e.g.,trilinear MIP-mapping).

nodes.label: Application of spatial data structures trendering.
nodes.title: Application of spatial data structures trendering.
nodes.description: Application of spatial data structures trendering.: Spatial data structures, such as bounding volume hierarchies (BVHs) and octrees, are used to efficiently organize and search for objects in a scene, improving rendering performance and scalability.

nodes.label: Sampling and anti-aliasing.
nodes.title: Sampling and anti-aliasing.
nodes.description: Sampling and anti-aliasing.: Sampling techniques are used to discretize continuous geometric and lighting data into discrete values for rendering. Anti-aliasing techniques are used to reduce visual artifacts caused by aliasing effects, such as jagged edges and pixelation.

nodes.label: Scene graphs.
nodes.title: Scene graphs.
nodes.description: Scene graphs.: Scene graphs are hierarchical data structures used to represent the objects, transformations, and relationships in a 3D scene, facilitating efficient traversal, manipulation, and rendering of the scene.

nodes.label: Geometric Modeling
nodes.title: Geometric Modeling
nodes.description: Geometric Modeling: involves the representation, manipulation, and visualization of geometric shapes and objects in computer graphics and CAD applications.

nodes.label: Basic geometric operations
nodes.title: Basic geometric operations
nodes.description: Basic geometric operations: such as intersection calculation and proxinity tests

nodes.label: Surface representation/model
nodes.title: Surface representation/model
nodes.description: Surface representation/model: Surfaces are represented using mathematical equations, such as parametric or implicit representations, which describe the geometry of the surface.

nodes.label: Tessellation
nodes.title: Tessellation
nodes.description: Tessellation: Tessellation is the process of subdividing a surface into smaller geometric primitives, such as triangles or quadrilaterals, for rendering and manipulation purposes.

nodes.label: Mesh representation, mesh fairing, and mesh generation techniques
nodes.title: Mesh representation, mesh fairing, and mesh generation techniques
nodes.description: Mesh representation, mesh fairing, and mesh generation techniques : such as Delaunay triangulation, marching cubes

nodes.label: Parametric polynomial curves and surfaces
nodes.title: Parametric polynomial curves and surfaces
nodes.description: Parametric polynomial curves and surfaces: Parametric curves and surfaces are defined using polynomial equations and are commonly used in CAD applications for modeling smooth shapes.

nodes.label: Implicit representation of curves and surfaces
nodes.title: Implicit representation of curves and surfaces
nodes.description: Implicit representation of curves and surfaces: Implicit equations describe surfaces as the zero sets of functions and are used for modeling complex and irregular shapes.

nodes.label: Spatial subdivision techniques
nodes.title: Spatial subdivision techniques
nodes.description: Spatial subdivision techniques: Spatial subdivision methods, such as octrees and binary space partitioning trees, are used to efficiently organize and search geometric data in 3D space.

nodes.label: Volumetric representation/model
nodes.title: Volumetric representation/model
nodes.description: Volumetric representation/model: Volumetric models represent objects as a collection of voxels or points in 3D space and are used in medical imaging, computer graphics, and simulation.

nodes.label: Volumes, voxels, and point-based representations.
nodes.title: Volumes, voxels, and point-based representations.
nodes.description: Volumes, voxels, and point-based representations.:

nodes.label: Signed Distance Fields
nodes.title: Signed Distance Fields
nodes.description: Signed Distance Fields: Signed distance fields represent the distance from each point in space to the nearest surface and are used for various geometric operations, such as ray tracing and collision detection.

nodes.label: Sparse Volumes, ie., VDB
nodes.title: Sparse Volumes, ie., VDB
nodes.description: Sparse Volumes, ie., VDB: Sparse volume representations store voxel data efficiently by only storing non-empty regions of space, reducing memory consumption and computational overhead.

nodes.label: Constructive Solid Geometry (CSG) representation
nodes.title: Constructive Solid Geometry (CSG) representation
nodes.description: Constructive Solid Geometry (CSG) representation: CSG operations combine primitive shapes using Boolean operations (union, intersection, difference) to create complex shapes.

nodes.label: Procedural representation/model
nodes.title: Procedural representation/model
nodes.description: Procedural representation/model: 1, Fractals. 2,L-Systems, cross referenced with programming languages (grammars tgenerated pictures).

nodes.label: Procedural models
nodes.title: Procedural models
nodes.description: Procedural models: such as fractals, generative modeling

nodes.label: Elastically deformation and freeform deformable models.
nodes.title: Elastically deformation and freeform deformable models.
nodes.description: Elastically deformation and freeform deformable models.: 1,Quasi-static methods. 2, Bi-harmonic capture/deform

nodes.label: Mutresolution modeling.
nodes.title: Mutresolution modeling.
nodes.description: Mutresolution modeling.: The key idea is to create a hierarchical data structure that allows for efficient storage, transmission, and rendering of complex geometry by storing multiple versions of an object at different levels of detail (LODs).

nodes.label: Reconstruction.
nodes.title: Reconstruction.
nodes.description: Reconstruction.: Reconstruction techniques convert 2D or 3D data (e.g., point clouds, images) into geometric models, commonly used in computer vision, medical imaging, and 3D scanning applications.

nodes.label: Shading
nodes.title: Shading
nodes.description: Shading:

nodes.label: Solutions and approximations to the rendering equation
nodes.title: Solutions and approximations to the rendering equation
nodes.description: Solutions and approximations to the rendering equation: for example: 1, Distribution ray tracing and path tracing; 2, Photon mapping; 3, Bidirectional path tracing; 4,Metropolis light transport;

nodes.label: Time (motion blur), lens position (focus), and continuous frequency (color) and their impact on rendering
nodes.title: Time (motion blur), lens position (focus), and continuous frequency (color) and their impact on rendering
nodes.description: Time (motion blur), lens position (focus), and continuous frequency (color) and their impact on rendering:

nodes.label: Shadow mapping
nodes.title: Shadow mapping
nodes.description: Shadow mapping: Shadow mapping is a technique used to simulate shadows in a scene by rendering depth information from the viewpoint of a light source and comparing it with the depth of objects from the camera's viewpoint to determine visibility.

nodes.label: Occlusion culling
nodes.title: Occlusion culling
nodes.description: Occlusion culling: Occlusion culling techniques identify and eliminate objects or parts of objects that are not visible to the camera, improving rendering performance by reducing unnecessary computations.

nodes.label: Bidirectional Scattering Distribution function (BSDF) theory and microfacets
nodes.title: Bidirectional Scattering Distribution function (BSDF) theory and microfacets
nodes.description: Bidirectional Scattering Distribution function (BSDF) theory and microfacets:

nodes.label: Subsurface scattering
nodes.title: Subsurface scattering
nodes.description: Subsurface scattering: Subsurface scattering refers to the phenomenon where light penetrates a translucent material, interacts with its interior, and emerges at a different point, creating soft and diffuse lighting effects. It is commonly used to render materials like skin, wax, and marble.

nodes.label: Area light sources
nodes.title: Area light sources
nodes.description: Area light sources: Area light sources are light-emitting surfaces with finite area, such as lamps or windows, which emit soft and realistic shadows compared to point lights. They require special handling in shading algorithms to accurately simulate their effects.

nodes.label: Hierarchical depth buffering
nodes.title: Hierarchical depth buffering
nodes.description: Hierarchical depth buffering: Hierarchical depth buffering is a technique used to optimize the rendering of scenes with complex geometry by organizing depth values into a hierarchical data structure, improving efficiency in depth testing and occlusion culling.

nodes.label: The Light Field, image-based rendering
nodes.title: The Light Field, image-based rendering
nodes.description: The Light Field, image-based rendering: The light field represents the distribution of light rays in a scene, enabling advanced rendering techniques such as image-based rendering, where images are synthesized from captured or computed light field data.

nodes.label: Non-photorealistic rendering
nodes.title: Non-photorealistic rendering
nodes.description: Non-photorealistic rendering: NPR techniques simulate artistic styles to produce images that resemble traditional media, cartoons, or illustrations, adding expressive and stylized effects to computer-generated imagery.

nodes.label: GPU architecture
nodes.title: GPU architecture
nodes.description: GPU architecture: GPU architecture influences the performance and capabilities of shading algorithms and rendering techniques.

nodes.label: Human visual systems
nodes.title: Human visual systems
nodes.description: Human visual systems: Understanding the human visual system helps in designing shading algorithms that produce visually appealing and realistic images by considering factors like color perception, contrast sensitivity, and visual acuity.

nodes.label: Computer Animation
nodes.title: Computer Animation
nodes.description: Computer Animation:

nodes.label: Principles of Animation
nodes.title: Principles of Animation
nodes.description: Principles of Animation: Squash and Stretch, Timing, Anticipation, Staging, Follow Through and Overlapping Action, Straight Ahead Action and Pose-to-Pose Action, Slow In and Out, Arcs, Exaggeration, and Appeal

nodes.label: Key-frame animation
nodes.title: Key-frame animation
nodes.description: Key-frame animation: Keyframe Interpolation Methods: Lerp / Slerp / Spline

nodes.label: Forward and inverse kinematics
nodes.title: Forward and inverse kinematics
nodes.description: Forward and inverse kinematics:

nodes.label: Skinning algorithms
nodes.title: Skinning algorithms
nodes.description: Skinning algorithms: 1, Capturing; 2, Linear blend, dual quaternion;

nodes.label: Rigging
nodes.title: Rigging
nodes.description: Rigging: Rigging is the process of creating skeletal structures (rigs) for characters or objects, including bones, joints, and controls, to facilitate animation.

nodes.label: Blend shapes
nodes.title: Blend shapes
nodes.description: Blend shapes: 1, Pose space deformation

nodes.label: Transforms
nodes.title: Transforms
nodes.description: Transforms: Transforms represent changes in position, rotation, and scale of objects in 3D space, crucial for animating objects and characters.

nodes.label: Translations
nodes.title: Translations
nodes.description: Translations:

nodes.label: Scale / Shear
nodes.title: Scale / Shear
nodes.description: Scale / Shear:

nodes.label: Rotations
nodes.title: Rotations
nodes.description: Rotations: 1, Euler angles; 2, Quaternions; 3, Angle/axis, exponential map;

nodes.label: Transformation Order:SRT /XYZ
nodes.title: Transformation Order:SRT /XYZ
nodes.description: Transformation Order:SRT /XYZ:

nodes.label: Camera animation
nodes.title: Camera animation
nodes.description: Camera animation: Animating the camera's position, orientation, and focal length adds cinematic movement and perspective to scenes, enhancing storytelling and visual impact.

nodes.label: Look at
nodes.title: Look at
nodes.description: Look at: Look at constraints or controllers orient objects or characters to face a specified target, useful for directing attention or creating interactive behaviors.

nodes.label: Focus
nodes.title: Focus
nodes.description: Focus: Focus controls adjust the depth of field in a scene, simulating realistic camera focus effects and directing viewer attention.

nodes.label: Motion capture
nodes.title: Motion capture
nodes.description: Motion capture: Motion capture (mocap) records real-world movement data from actors or objects and applies it to digital characters or models

nodes.label: Set up and fundamentals
nodes.title: Set up and fundamentals
nodes.description: Set up and fundamentals:

nodes.label: Ethical considerations (e.g., accessibility and privacy)
nodes.title: Ethical considerations (e.g., accessibility and privacy)
nodes.description: Ethical considerations (e.g., accessibility and privacy): Avoidance of "default” captures - there is ntypical human walk cycle

nodes.label: Simulation
nodes.title: Simulation
nodes.description: Simulation:

nodes.label: Collision detection and response
nodes.title: Collision detection and response
nodes.description: Collision detection and response: Algorithms for detecting collisions between objects and responding appropriately, including resolving intersections and applying forces.

nodes.label: Signed Distance Fields
nodes.title: Signed Distance Fields
nodes.description: Signed Distance Fields: Representations of surfaces in 3D space as the signed distance to the nearest surface point, useful for collision detection, rendering, and other applications.

nodes.label: Sphere/sphere
nodes.title: Sphere/sphere
nodes.description: Sphere/sphere: Specific types of collision detection algorithms for different geometric primitives.

nodes.label: Triangle/point
nodes.title: Triangle/point
nodes.description: Triangle/point: Specific types of collision detection algorithms for different geometric primitives.

nodes.label: Edge/edge
nodes.title: Edge/edge
nodes.description: Edge/edge: Specific types of collision detection algorithms for different geometric primitives.

nodes.label: Procedural animation using noise
nodes.title: Procedural animation using noise
nodes.description: Procedural animation using noise: Generating natural-looking motion and deformations using procedural noise functions, such as Perlin noise or simplex noise.

nodes.label: Particle systems
nodes.title: Particle systems
nodes.description: Particle systems: Simulating dynamic effects like fire, smoke, and explosions by modeling particles with properties like position, velocity, and lifespan.

nodes.label: Integration methods (Forward Euler, Midpoint, Leapfrog)
nodes.title: Integration methods (Forward Euler, Midpoint, Leapfrog)
nodes.description: Integration methods (Forward Euler, Midpoint, Leapfrog): Numerical methods for integrating equations of motion over time, including Forward Euler, Midpoint, and Leapfrog methods.

nodes.label: Mass/spring networks
nodes.title: Mass/spring networks
nodes.description: Mass/spring networks: Modeling deformable objects or soft bodies using interconnected masses and springs to simulate elasticity and deformation.

nodes.label: Position based dynamics
nodes.title: Position based dynamics
nodes.description: Position based dynamics: A simulation approach that focuses on satisfying constraints between object positions rather than explicitly computing forces.

nodes.label: Rules (boids/crowds)
nodes.title: Rules (boids/crowds)
nodes.description: Rules (boids/crowds): Behavioral rules governing the movement and interaction of agents in a simulation, such as flocking behavior in bird flocks or crowd simulation in urban environments.

nodes.label: Rigid bodies
nodes.title: Rigid bodies
nodes.description: Rigid bodies: Simulating rigid objects with fixed shapes and masses, accounting for collisions, friction, and constraints.

nodes.label: Grid based fluids
nodes.title: Grid based fluids
nodes.description: Grid based fluids: Simulating fluid behavior using a grid-based approach, including techniques like Eulerian fluid simulation and Navier-Stokes equations.

nodes.label: Semi-Lagrangian advection
nodes.title: Semi-Lagrangian advection
nodes.description: Semi-Lagrangian advection: A method for simulating fluid flow by tracing particle trajectories in a Lagrangian frame and advecting properties through a grid.

nodes.label: Pressure Projection
nodes.title: Pressure Projection
nodes.description: Pressure Projection: A technique for enforcing incompressibility in fluid simulations by projecting velocity fields onto a divergence-free space.

nodes.label: Heightfields
nodes.title: Heightfields
nodes.description: Heightfields: Representations of terrain or landscapes using 2D grids of elevation values, commonly used in terrain modeling and simulation.

nodes.label: Terrain: Transport, erosion
nodes.title: Terrain: Transport, erosion
nodes.description: Terrain: Transport, erosion: Simulating erosion processes like water flow, sediment transport, and terrain modification over time.

nodes.label: Water: Ripple, Shallow water.
nodes.title: Water: Ripple, Shallow water.
nodes.description: Water: Ripple, Shallow water.: Modeling water behavior, including surface ripples, waves, and shallow water dynamics, using fluid simulation techniques.

nodes.label: Rule-based system
nodes.title: Rule-based system
nodes.description: Rule-based system: Using sets of rules to model complex behavior or interactions between entities in a simulation, such as cellular automata or rule-based growth systems.

nodes.label: LSystems.
nodes.title: LSystems.
nodes.description: LSystems.: Models for generating organic or branching structures, such as trees or plants, using recursive rules.

nodes.label: Space-colonizing systems.
nodes.title: Space-colonizing systems.
nodes.description: Space-colonizing systems.: Models for generating organic or branching structures, such as trees or plants, using recursive rules.

nodes.label: Game of Life
nodes.title: Game of Life
nodes.description: Game of Life: A cellular automaton simulation with simple rules for evolving patterns on a grid, used as a model for emergent behavior and complex systems.

nodes.label: Immersion
nodes.title: Immersion
nodes.description: Immersion:

nodes.label: Define and distinguish VR, AR, and MR
nodes.title: Define and distinguish VR, AR, and MR
nodes.description: Define and distinguish VR, AR, and MR:

nodes.label: Stereoscopic display
nodes.title: Stereoscopic display
nodes.description: Stereoscopic display: Stereoscopic displays present separate images to each eye to create the illusion of depth perception

nodes.label: Viewer tracking
nodes.title: Viewer tracking
nodes.description: Viewer tracking: Viewer tracking technologies, such as positional tracking and eye tracking, monitor the user's movements and actions within the virtual environment, allowing for real-time interaction and immersion.

nodes.label: Inside out vs Outside In
nodes.title: Inside out vs Outside In
nodes.description: Inside out vs Outside In: Inside-out tracking involves sensors on the VR device detecting the user's movements relative to their environment, while outside-in tracking relies on external sensors or cameras to track the user's position and movements.

nodes.label: Head/ Body/ Hand / tracking
nodes.title: Head/ Body/ Hand / tracking
nodes.description: Head/ Body/ Hand / tracking: Tracking technologies monitor the user's head, body, and hand movements, enabling natural interaction with virtual objects and environments.

nodes.label: Visibility computation
nodes.title: Visibility computation
nodes.description: Visibility computation: Visibility computation algorithms determine which objects and surfaces are visible to the user's viewpoint, optimizing rendering performance and enhancing immersion by presenting realistic scenes.

nodes.label: Time-critical rendering, multiple levels of details (LOD) Image-based VR system
nodes.title: Time-critical rendering, multiple levels of details (LOD) Image-based VR system
nodes.description: Time-critical rendering, multiple levels of details (LOD) Image-based VR system:

nodes.label: Motion to Photon latency
nodes.title: Motion to Photon latency
nodes.description: Motion to Photon latency: Motion-to-photon latency measures the time delay between the user's movement and the corresponding change in the VR display

nodes.label: Distributed VR, collaboration over computer network
nodes.title: Distributed VR, collaboration over computer network
nodes.description: Distributed VR, collaboration over computer network:

nodes.label: Interactive modeling
nodes.title: Interactive modeling
nodes.description: Interactive modeling: interactive modeling tools allow users to create and manipulate virtual objects and environments in real-time

nodes.title: Applications in medicine, simulation, training, and visualization
nodes.description: Applications in medicine, simulation, training, and visualization:

nodes.title: Event Driven Programming
nodes.description: Event Driven Programming: 1, Mouse or touch events; 2, Keyboard events; 3, Voice input; 4, Sensors; 5, Message passing communication; 6, Network events; 7, Interrupt event processing;

nodes.title: Graphical User Interface (Single Channel)

nodes.description: Gestural Interfaces: Accessibility - other approaches if gesture not possible (Inject "thumbs up" without a thumb)

nodes.description: Haptic Interfaces: 1, External actuators; 2, Gloves; 3, Exoskeletons;

nodes.label: Multimodal Interfaces
nodes.title: Multimodal Interfaces
nodes.description: Multimodal Interfaces: Multimodal interfaces combine multiple modes of interaction, such as voice, gesture, touch, and gaze

nodes.label: Immersive Interfaces (Al)
nodes.title: Immersive Interfaces (Al)
nodes.description: Immersive Interfaces (Al): 1, brainwave (EEG type electrodes); 2, headsets with embedded eye tracking. 3, AR glasses;

nodes.label: Accessibility
nodes.title: Accessibility
nodes.description: Accessibility : Accessibility in interaction design focuses on ensuring that digital systems and interfaces are usable and inclusive for users with diverse abilities and needs

nodes.label: Image Processing
nodes.title: Image Processing
nodes.description: Image Processing : Image processing involves manipulating digital images to improve their quality or extract useful information.

nodes.label: Morphological operations
nodes.title: Morphological operations
nodes.description: Morphological operations: Morphological operations are mathematical operations applied to binary or grayscale images to manipulate their shape and structure. These operations include dilation, erosion, opening, closing, and more.

nodes.label: Connected components
nodes.title: Connected components
nodes.description: Connected components: Connected components analysis identifies and labels distinct regions or objects within an image based on their connectivity.

nodes.label: Dilation
nodes.title: Dilation
nodes.description: Dilation: Dilation is a morphological operation that expands the boundaries of objects in a binary image.

nodes.label: Erosion
nodes.title: Erosion
nodes.description: Erosion: Erosion is a morphological operation that shrinks the boundaries of objects in a binary image.

nodes.label: Computing region properties (area, perimeter, centroid, etc.)
nodes.title: Computing region properties (area, perimeter, centroid, etc.)
nodes.description: Computing region properties (area, perimeter, centroid, etc.): After segmentation, computing region properties such as area, perimeter, centroid, and bounding box helps characterize and analyze the identified regions or objects within an image.

nodes.label: Color histograms
nodes.title: Color histograms
nodes.description: Color histograms:

nodes.label: Representation
nodes.title: Representation
nodes.description: Representation: Color histograms represent the distribution of colors in an image by counting the frequency of each color or intensity level.

nodes.label: Contrast enhancement through normalization
nodes.title: Contrast enhancement through normalization
nodes.description: Contrast enhancement through normalization: Contrast enhancement techniques adjust the intensity distribution of an image to improve visibility and enhance details. Normalization is one such technique that stretches the intensity values of an image to span the full dynamic range, effectively increasing the image's contrast.

nodes.label: Image enhancement
nodes.title: Image enhancement
nodes.description: Image enhancement:

nodes.label: Convolution
nodes.title: Convolution
nodes.description: Convolution: Convolution is a fundamental operation in image processing where a filter kernel is applied to an image to perform various operations like blurring, edge detection, or sharpening.

nodes.label: Blur (e.g., Gaussian)
nodes.title: Blur (e.g., Gaussian)
nodes.description: Blur (e.g., Gaussian): Gaussian blur is a common technique used to blur an image by convolving it with a Gaussian kernel.

nodes.label: Sharpen (Laplacian)
nodes.title: Sharpen (Laplacian)
nodes.description: Sharpen (Laplacian): Laplacian sharpening enhances the edges and details in an image by accentuating high-frequency components.

nodes.label: Frequency fltering (low-pass, high-pass)
nodes.title: Frequency fltering (low-pass, high-pass)
nodes.description: Frequency fltering (low-pass, high-pass): Frequency filtering techniques manipulate the frequency components of an image to achieve specific effects.

nodes.label: Image restoration
nodes.title: Image restoration
nodes.description: Image restoration:

nodes.label: Noise, degradation
nodes.title: Noise, degradation
nodes.description: Noise, degradation: Image restoration aims to recover the original image from degraded or noisy versions. This includes removing noise caused by sensor imperfections, compression artifacts, or environmental factors, as well as restoring lost or damaged image information.

nodes.label: Inpainting and other completion algorithms
nodes.title: Inpainting and other completion algorithms
nodes.description: Inpainting and other completion algorithms: Inpainting algorithms reconstruct missing or damaged parts of an image based on surrounding information.

nodes.label: Wiener filter
nodes.title: Wiener filter
nodes.description: Wiener filter: The Wiener filter is a signal processing filter used in image restoration to remove noise while preserving image details.

nodes.label: Image coding
nodes.title: Image coding
nodes.description: Image coding:

nodes.label: Redundancy
nodes.title: Redundancy
nodes.description: Redundancy: Redundancy refers to patterns or information that can be predicted or represented more efficiently.

nodes.label: Huffman coding
nodes.title: Huffman coding
nodes.description: Huffman coding: Huffman coding is a lossless data compression technique that assigns variable-length codes to symbols based on their frequency of occurrence in the data.

nodes.label: DCT, wavelet transform, Fourier transforms
nodes.title: DCT, wavelet transform, Fourier transforms
nodes.description: DCT, wavelet transform, Fourier transforms: Transform-based image coding methods, such as Discrete Cosine Transform (DCT), Wavelet Transform, and Fourier Transforms, analyze the frequency components of an image and represent it in a more compact form.

nodes.label: Nyquist Theorem
nodes.title: Nyquist Theorem
nodes.description: Nyquist Theorem: The Nyquist theorem states that to accurately reconstruct a signal, including digital images, its sampling rate must be at least twice the highest frequency present in the signal.

nodes.label: Watermarks
nodes.title: Watermarks
nodes.description: Watermarks: Ethical considerations

nodes.label: Emerging area
nodes.title: Emerging area
nodes.description: Emerging area:

nodes.label: Convolutional Neural Networks
nodes.title: Convolutional Neural Networks
nodes.description: Convolutional Neural Networks: CNNs are a class of deep learning models designed for processing structured grid data, such as images.

nodes.label: Transformers
nodes.title: Transformers
nodes.description: Transformers: Transformers are a type of deep learning architecture originally designed for natural language processing tasks.

nodes.label: SEP issues
nodes.title: SEP issues
nodes.description: SEP issues:

nodes.label: Deep fakes
nodes.title: Deep fakes
nodes.description: Deep fakes: Deep fakes are AI-generated synthetic media, including images and videos, that convincingly depict people saying or doing things they never did.

nodes.label: Applications that misidentify people based on skin color or hairstyle
nodes.title: Applications that misidentify people based on skin color or hairstyle
nodes.description: Applications that misidentify people based on skin color or hairstyle: Biased algorithms or poorly designed computer vision systems can perpetuate racial or gender biases by misidentifying or underrepresenting individuals based on their skin color, ethnicity, or hairstyle.

nodes.label: Tangible/Physical Computing
nodes.title: Tangible/Physical Computing
nodes.description: Tangible/Physical Computing:

nodes.label: Communication with the physical world
nodes.title: Communication with the physical world
nodes.description: Communication with the physical world:

nodes.label: Acquisition of data from sensors
nodes.title: Acquisition of data from sensors
nodes.description: Acquisition of data from sensors: This involves collecting data from various sensors such as temperature sensors, accelerometers, cameras, etc.

nodes.label: Driving external actuators
nodes.title: Driving external actuators
nodes.description: Driving external actuators: Actuators are devices that convert electrical signals into physical actions. Examples include motors, solenoids, and relays.

nodes.label: Event driven programming (see Interaction topic)
nodes.title: Event driven programming (see Interaction topic)
nodes.description: Event driven programming (see Interaction topic): Event-driven programming is a programming paradigm where the flow of the program is determined by events such as user actions, sensor inputs, or system events.

nodes.label: Connection to physical artifacts
nodes.title: Connection to physical artifacts
nodes.description: Connection to physical artifacts:

nodes.label: Computer Aided Design
nodes.title: Computer Aided Design
nodes.description: Computer Aided Design: CAD software is used to create, modify, and analyze designs for various physical artifacts such as buildings, machinery, and consumer products.

nodes.label: Computer Aided Manufacturing
nodes.title: Computer Aided Manufacturing
nodes.description: Computer Aided Manufacturing: CAM software is used to generate instructions for manufacturing processes based on CAD designs.

nodes.label: Fabrication
nodes.title: Fabrication
nodes.description: Fabrication: 1, HCl prototyping (see HCI); 2, Additive (3D printing); 3, Subtractive (CNC miling); 4, Forming (vacuum forming);

nodes.label: Internet of Things (reference Networking)
nodes.title: Internet of Things (reference Networking)
nodes.description: Internet of Things (reference Networking):

nodes.label: Network connectivity
nodes.title: Network connectivity
nodes.description: Network connectivity: IoT devices require network connectivity to communicate with each other, cloud services, and other systems.

nodes.label: Wireless communication
nodes.title: Wireless communication
nodes.description: Wireless communication: Wireless communication technologies play a crucial role in IoT deployments by enabling flexible and scalable connectivity without the need for physical wired connections.

nodes.label: SEP issue
nodes.title: SEP issue
nodes.description: SEP issue: Privacy concerns in the IoT ecosystem revolve around the collection, storage, and use of personal data generated by IoT devices.
